sen.j: 梅戸 勝之進（うめど かつのしん、生没年不明）は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Katsunoshin UMEDO (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of Shinsengumi.
Katsunoshin UMEDO (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: the Shinsengumi に訂正しました。
sen.e: Katsunoshin UMEDO (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Shinsengumi.
His birthplace was unknown.
His birthplace is unknown.
sen.cmt: was ⇒ is に訂正しました。
sen.e: His birthplace is unknown.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）頃に新選組に入隊。
sen.e: He joined Shinsengumi in around 1866.
He joined the Shinsengumi in around 1866.
sen.cmt: the Shinsengumi に訂正しました。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi in around 1866.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）6月には、見廻組並御雇の格を受けている。
sen.e: He was given the status, Mimawarigumi and Oyatoi, in June, 1867.
He was given the status, Mimawarigumi and Oyatoi, in June, 1867.
He was given the status, Mimawarigumi and Oyatoi, in June, 1867.

sen.j: 天満屋事件において、苦戦していた斎藤一を助けて重傷を負った。
sen.e: During Tenmanya Incident, he helped Hajime SAITO who had a hard fight and was seriously injured.
During Tenmanya Incident, he helped Hajime SAITO who had a hard fight and was seriously injured.
During Tenmanya Incident, he helped Hajime SAITO who had a hard fight and was seriously injured.

sen.j: 一命は取り留め、鳥羽伏見の戦いには旗役として新選組に従軍。
sen.e: He escaped death and served in Shinsengumi as hatayaku (flag man) in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi.
He escaped death and served in the Shinsengumi as hatayaku (flag man) in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi.
sen.cmt: the Shinsengumi に訂正しました。
sen.e: He escaped death and served in the Shinsengumi as hatayaku (flag man) in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi.

sen.j: 顔に生々しい刀痕が残っていたと言う。
sen.e: It is said that he still had the fresh scar from a sword wound on his face.
It is said that he still had the fresh scar from a sword wound on his face.
It is said that he still had the fresh scar from a sword wound on his face.

sen.j: 甲州勝沼の戦い後、斎藤一らと共に会津へ赴き駕籠役を務める。
sen.e: After the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma, he went to Aizu with Hajime SAITO to serve as a role of Kagoyaku (the role of palanquin).
After the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma, he went to Aizu with Hajime SAITO to serve as a role of Kagoyaku (the role of palanquin).
After the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma, he went to Aizu with Hajime SAITO to serve as a role of Kagoyaku (the role of palanquin).

sen.j: その後、9月12日に仙台で降伏。
sen.e: Then he surrendered to the enemy in Sendai on September 12.
Then he surrendered to the enemy in Sendai on September 12.
Then he surrendered to the enemy in Sendai on September 12.
After that, he was never heard from again.
After that, he was never heard from again.
After that, he was never heard from again.

sen.j: 新選組慰霊碑の建立された明治9年（1876年）以前に没したと思われる。
sen.e: It is considered that he had already died before the erection of memorial monument of Shinsengumi in 1876.
It is considered that he had already died before the erection of the memorial monument of the Shinsengumi in 1876.
sen.cmt: the memorial monument, the Shinsengumi に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is considered that he had already died before the erection of the memorial monument of the Shinsengumi in 1876.
